title: Six Nations closed to Georgia
text:
Six Nations has 'no vacancy' for Georgia Last Updated: 22/02/17 9:57am Georgia are ranked above Italy in the Six Nations Georgia have been told there is "no vacancy" in the Six Nations, despite being ranked above Italy in the world rankings. 
Italy joined what was then the Five Nations in 2000, but progress has been limited since, and this season they have been well beaten at home by Wales and then hammered in Rome by Ireland. 
The rapidly-improving Georgians, who impressed hugely in the 2015 World Cup, have overtaken the Azzurri in the world rankings, and they were hoping that the Six Nations could open up to them with a promotion-relegation clash. 
Georgia have won the second-tier Rugby Europe Championship for the last six years but Six Nations chief executive John Feehan told the Daily Mail : "It is a closed competition, owned and controlled by the six unions concerned. Georgia performed heroically against the All Blacks in the 2015 World Cup 
"There is no vacancy. Right now we are perfectly happy that we have the six strongest teams in Europe in our competition." 
He said Italy's terrible form in this year's competition could not be taken in isolation, and urged their critics to take a longer view. New Zealand's Sonny Bill Williams is tackled during the match against Georgia 
"You wait for the weakest animal to fall and you are on top of them,' he said. "Are we closed to every scenario? No, but it takes a while to see a convincing argument - 10 or 15 years. 
"We have to take a good, considered view about what is right for our six unions. They would all have to agree that this is what they want. At this stage, talk of bringing in other teams is premature." Also See:
